title: Public transport for TWICE in concert: Saturday 4 November 2023
articleContent:
Public transport for TWICE in concert: Saturday 4 November 2023

TWICE will bring their READY TO BE: PART 3 tour to Melbourne’s Marvel Stadium on Saturday, November 4, the first female group to headline a stadium in Australia, and the first KPOP stadium concert to be held in Australia! Extra services will help you get home from Marvel Stadium on Saturday 4 November 2023

Gates open at 5pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

Please note: The Marvel Stadium car park will remain available via Flinders Street while Wurundjeri Way and Dudley Street intersection is closed. Please allow extra time if travelling by car as significant delays are expected. Alternatively, extra public transport services are running to get you to and from the event.

 Metropolitan train

Trains arriving Southern Cross before the concert, as follows:

  • Mernda departing at 3:31pm, arriving on Platform 9 at 4:27pm
  • Greensborough departing at 3:55pm, arriving on Platform 9 at 4:37pm
  • Syndal departing at 3:57pm, arriving on Platform 10 at 4:37pm

Trains depart Southern Cross after the concert ends, as follows:

  • Mernda departing at 11:22pm and 11:43pm, Platform 9
  • Greensborough departing at 11:31pm and 11:39pm, Platform 9
  • Lilydale departing at 11:19pm, Platform 10
  • Belgrave departing at 11:29pm, Platform 10
  • Glen Waverley departing at 11:15pm and 11:24pm, Platform 10
  • Sandringham departing at 11:15pm and 11:40pm, Platform 13
  • Pakenham departing at 11:15pm and 11:24pm, Platform 12
  • Werribee departing at 11:24pm and 11:44pm, Platform 14
  • Sunbury departing at 11:18pm and 11:27pm, Platform 11
  • Craigieburn departing at 11:13pm and 11:30pm, Platform 11
  • Southern Cross to Flinders Street departing at 11:24pm, Platform 13
  • Frankston departing at 11:20pm and 11:44pm, Platform 13

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from Marvel Stadium

Extra trams will operate as Route 30a between East Melbourne and Stop D1 Etihad Stadium via La Trobe Street.

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Metropolitan bus

Passengers can catch the following bus routes close to Marvel Stadium:

  • Route 232 (Altona North to City)
  • Route 235 (Fishermans Bend to City)
  • Route 302 (Box Hill to City)
  • Route 304 (Doncaster SC to City)
  • Route 905 (The Pines SC to City)
  • Route 906 (Warrandyte to City)
  • Route 907 (Mitcham to City)

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Regional train

Normal timetable trains and consists will operate.

All replacement coaches will be leaving from Southern Cross Bus terminal. Passengers are advised to expect queues and delay when returning to this terminal. Please listen to announcements for the designated coach bays for departure.

Plan your journey using Journey planner.
articleDescription: In his first Australian tour since 2017, Paul McCartney brings his phenomenal Got Back Tour to Marvel Stadium on Saturday 21 October 2023.
